page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: The A92 in the west of the block has hourly{bus}connections North and South and Citylink and Stagecoach services. There is a Community Bus Service along the B967 to Stonehaven and return on Friday mornings. The smaller roads have no public service. The nearest {railway}stations are Stonehaven and Montrose.Most adults can drive and most people have access to{private {transport.}Those without have to use the community bus service or {taxis,}e.g.to visit the Surgery in Inverbervie.A few people{walk}up to a mile to the shop or playgroup.There are no pavements.With so many cars, most people travel further nowadays to shop and for amenities, and walk less than previous generations.{Cycling}is still popular, particularly for children enabling them to see their friends, run errands and explore.
